posts.title: Pumpkin Chocolate Chip Bars
posts.content: These bars are THE most soft & fluffy!  The warm, melted chocolate chunks compliment the fluffy texture.  They’re simple to make & such a treat.
posts.recipe:
1/2 c + 1 tbsp butter, softened
3/4 c white sugar
1 tsp dark brown sugar
1 egg
2 tsp vanilla extract or paste
1 1/2 c GF APF 
1 tsp cream of tartar
1/2 tsp baking soda
1/4 tsp salt
1 tsp cinnamon
1 tsp nutmeg
1/4 tsp cardamom
1/4 cup sugar
2 tsp cinnamon
1 tsp nutmeg
1/4 tsp cardamom


Preheat oven 350F & line baking sheet with parchment paper. 
Combine dry ingredients in medium bowl whisk flour, cream of tartar, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, cardamom. Set aside. 
In large bowl with electric mixer beat butter & sugars together until fluffy. 
Add egg & vanilla to mixture- continue mixing until blended. 
Add dry ingredients bowl to the butter egg mixture & combine using spatula until soft & incorporated. 
In small bowl combine the 1/4 c sugar, 2 tsp cinnamon, 1 tsp nutmeg & 1/4 tsp cardamom. Scoop out 2 tbsp sized cookie dough balls, roll them with your hands, then toss them in the sugar mixture you just made. 
Place cookie dough balls on baking sheet 2 inches apart & bake for 8-10 mins. After cooling completely, drizzle caramel sauce on the tops of each. Enjoy!

posts.title: Cinnamon Sugar Donuts
posts.content: Fall season is here!  Celebrate by baking these fun & easy to make pumpkin shaped donuts.  Cinnamon sugar coated, fluffy, & filled with a chocolate mascarpone cream.
posts.recipe:
*dutch oven or small soup pot for frying donuts
*butcher’s twine for pumpkin shaping
*cinnamon sticks cut into halves for stems
* 2 tsp dry active yeast
* 6 tbsp warm water 110º F
* 2 tbsp sugar
* 1 ½ c (GF) APF
* ⅛ tsp salt
* ⅓ c canned coconut milk
* 1 egg large
* 2 tbsp melted butter
* 1 bottle of canola or vegetable oil
* 1/2 c powdered sugar 
* 1/4 c granulated sugar

CHOCOLATE MASCARPONE CREAM
*1/4 c mascarpone cheese
*2 c heavy cream
*1/3 c powdered sugar
*1-2 tbsp cocoa powder 

*cinnamon + sugar for donut coating



1.  In small dish, add warm water, yeast, and sugar. Allow yeast to sit 10 minutes until foamy.
2. Add dry ingredients to a bowl and whisk to blend. Pour yeast mixture, eggs, milk, and butter into the bowl.
3. Mix or knead ingredients together to form a soft dough.  Cover bowl with plastic wrap, allow the dough to rise 45-60 minutes in warm area. I rest mine on a 77F proofing mat. 
4. Remove plastic, dust surface with flour, carefully take out dough.  Cut dough into 4-5 tbsp sized balls. Roll each to form dough balls. 
5. Heat oil 315-330F in Dutch oven or small soup pot, filled about 3 inches height wise. 
6.While oil is heating, cut butcher’s twine into 4 strings, 8-9 inch long each, which holds one dough ball.  Lay strings out flat on surface overlapping the one before, pointing strings as clock hands 12&6, 3&9, 4:30&10:30, 7:30&1:30. Place dough ball in middle of strings. Carefully lift strings upward gently, & tie the strings in a single knot, around dough ball as shown in video. Repeat this for every dough ball. Set each aside. 
7. Carefully place dough balls 2 at a time in hot oil & fry for few mins on each side until lightly golden brown. Carefully toss donuts in equal parts cinnamon & sugar mixture in small bowl. Lay each on paper towel to drain & cool completely. 
8. Make the mascarpone cream by whisking all ingredients w/electric mixer on medium high in a bowl until smooth & fluffy. Put in piping bag or ziplock bag. 
9. Once pumpkin donuts are cooled. Using end of a chopstick poke hole in middle of each donut & fill with mascarpone cream. Place cinnamon stick inside for stem. Enjoy!

posts.title: Cinnamon Sugar Pumpkin Donuts
posts.content: Fall season is here!  Celebrate by baking these fun & easy to make pumpkin shaped donuts.  Cinnamon sugar coated, fluffy, & filled with a chocolate mascarpone cream.
posts.recipe:
*dutch oven or small soup pot for frying donuts
*butcher’s twine for pumpkin shaping
*cinnamon sticks cut into halves for stems
* 2 tsp dry active yeast
* 6 tbsp warm water 110º F
* 2 tbsp sugar
* 1 ½ c (GF) APF I used Cup4Cup All Purpose Flour
* ⅛ tsp salt
* ⅓ c canned coconut milk
* 1 egg large
* 2 tbsp melted butter
* 1 bottle of canola or vegetable oil
* 1/2 c powdered sugar 
* 1/4 c granulated sugar

CHOCOLATE MASCARPONE CREAM
*1/4 c mascarpone cheese
*2 c heavy cream
*1/3 c powdered sugar
*1-2 tbsp cocoa powder 
*cinnamon + sugar for donut coating


1.  In small dish, add warm water, yeast, and sugar. Allow yeast to sit 10 minutes until foamy.
2. Add dry ingredients to a bowl and whisk to blend. Pour yeast mixture, eggs, milk, and butter into the bowl.
3. Mix or knead ingredients together to form a soft dough.  Cover bowl with plastic wrap, allow the dough to rise 45-60 minutes in warm area. I rest mine on a 77F proofing mat. 
4. Remove plastic, dust surface with flour, carefully take out dough.  Cut dough into 4-5 tbsp sized balls. Roll each to form dough balls. 
5. Heat oil 315-330F in Dutch oven or small soup pot, filled about 3 inches height wise. 
6. While oil is heating, cut butcher’s twine into 4 strings, 8-9 inch long each, which holds one dough ball.  Lay strings out flat on surface overlapping the one before, pointing strings as clock hands 12&6, 3&9, 4:30&10:30, 7:30&1:30. Place dough ball in middle of strings. Carefully lift strings upward gently, & tie the strings in a single knot, around dough ball as shown in video. Repeat this for every dough ball. Set each aside. 
7. Carefully place dough balls 2 at a time in hot oil & fry for few mins on each side until lightly golden brown. Carefully toss donuts in equal parts cinnamon & sugar mixture in small bowl. Lay each on paper towel to drain & cool completely. 
8. Make the mascarpone cream by whisking all ingredients w/electric mixer on medium high in a bowl until smooth & fluffy. Put in piping bag or ziplock bag. 
9. Once pumpkin donuts are cooled. Using end of a chopstick poke hole in middle of each donut & fill with mascarpone cream. Place cinnamon stick inside for stem. Enjoy!

posts.title: Red Velvet Brownies
posts.content: These are stunners!  They’re fudgey, gooey, & SO easy to make.
posts.recipe:
*¾ c unsalted butter room temperature
*1 1/3 c granulated sugar
*2 eggs
*1 tsp white vinegar 
*2 tsp  vanilla extract
*1 ½ c GF APF 
*3 tbsp cocoa powder
*¼ tsp  salt
*1-2 tsp red food coloring 
*1 c chocolate chips


1. Preheat oven 350F & line 8x8 baking pan with parchment paper. 
2. In large mixing bowl, beat butter & sugar until fluffy. 
3. Add in egg, white vinegar, vanilla & mix again. 
4. Add flour, cocoa powder, salt & mix until combined. 
5. Add red food coloring to your liking. 
6. Add chocolate chips in & fold gently. 
7. Pour batter into prepared baking dish & bake 28-32 mins or until brownies reach internal temperature of atleast 170F. Toothpick can come out with few crumbs for fudgy brownies. Enjoy!

posts.title: new
posts.recipe:
1/3 cup extra virgin olive oil
▢1/3 cup mayo
▢2 tablespoons lemon juice
▢2 teaspoons dijon mustard
▢2 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce
▢1-2 cloves garlic, grated
